name: 張淑美
objective:
本課程將討論可持續發展的原則，結合了化學原理與最新的綠色化學技術，強調可再生資源的運用、廢棄物減量和環保製程。學生將學到如何設計具有較低環境影響的新型材料，探索綠色合成方法，以及瞭解綠色能源的應用。
This course explores the principles of sustainable development in green chemistry technologies, including renewable resources, minimizing waste, and employing eco-friendly processes. Students will acquire the skills to design innovative materials with a diminished environmental footprint, delve into green synthesis   and green energy.
schedule:
Week 1-2: Introduction to Sustainable Chemistry
Week 3-4: Green Chemistry Principles and SDGs
Week 5-6: Renewable Resources in Chemistry
Week 7-8: Life Cycle Assessment (LCA)
Week 9-10: Energy Efficiency in Chemical Processes
Week 11-12: Waste Minimization and Resource Efficiency
Week 13-14: Green Solvents and Catalysts
Week 15-16: Bio-based Chemistry
Week 17: Regulatory and Ethical Considerations
Week 18: Future Trends and Innovations
scorePolicy:

2. Particiption: 15%

1.	"Green Chemistry: Theory and Practice", Paul T. Anastas and John C. Warner, 2000, Oxford University Press. Or "Green Chemistry: Theory and Practice", Paul T. Anastas and Nicolas Eghbali, 2009, Chem. Soc. Rev. 39, 301-312.
2.	“Introduction to green chemistry”, John Andraos, Albert S. Matlack., Andraos, John, 2022, 3rd ed., CRC Press.
